item.title: Cyberpunk 2077: All Iconic Blunt Weapons & How to Get Them
item.description:
If players want to bludgeon their foes and use their mighty strength to club and smash the gangs of Night City in Cyberpunk 2077 , then they are going to want to know how to get the best blunt weapons. The best blunt weapons in Cyberpunk 2077 range from one-handed and two-handed weapons, allowing players to lay down the law and smack their foes so that every hit puts them closer to becoming a Night City Legend.

Whether it’s to impress Johnny Silverhand or simply to indulge in the cyberpsycho within V, seeing a collection of all blunt weapons in Cyberpunk 2077 will provide players with a definite list of what weapon they might want to use to bash the brains of the fiercest competition in Night City.

11 Caretaker’s Spade

A Witcher Weapon That Carries Heavy Burdens and +12% Health Per Kill

Type

Hammer

Attack Speed

1.2

Damage Per Hit

190

Stamina Cost

16

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Stun Chance

Iconic Modifier

+12.5% health return on kills.

  • How to Get Caretaker's Spade: Found in the garden area of Arasaka Tower during Knockin' on Heaven's Door, the final mission when V picks Rogue.

As a heavy shovel that heals on kills, the Caretaker’s Spade might be a sought-after weapon, especially with its ties to the Caretaker from The Witcher 3: Hearts of Stone . However, this is a weapon exclusive to the Rogue ending path, leaving it in a spot where most players might be finished with the game, to make this weapon worth their time. The biggest issues with the Caretaker’s Spade are the fact that this weapon is burdened with a reduction to movement speed and jump height, and outside of hard-hitting damage, the Caretaker’s Spade doesn’t really do much else.

10 Baseball Bat x-MOD2

Fairly Safe and Standard for an Upgrade

Type

Two-Handed Club

Attack Speed

1.2

Damage Per Hit

190

Stamina Cost

12

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +30% Bleeding Chance
  • +20% Stun Chance

Iconic Modifier

A special version of the weapon capable of additional modification. Optimized design allows for improved handling.

Mod Slots

  • Melee Mod Slot
  • Melee Mod Slot

  • How to Get Baseball Bat x-MOD2: Looted on the boardwalk near the Black Sapphire in Dogtown (Phantom Liberty)

There isn't much to say about the Baseball Bat x-MOD 2 other than the fact that it's fairly average and supports the continued trend of x-MOD2 weapons. Modifications allow further synergy with different playstyles, and the improved handling doesn't mean anything for a baseball bat that's all about the swing, even if the damage is good and the stamina cost is decent, it just doesn't feel very Iconic.

9 Sasquatch’s Hammer

The Highest Damage At the Cost of the Slowest Movement

Type

Hammer

Attack Speed

0.8

Damage Per Hit

417

Stamina Cost

16

Effects

  • +75% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Stun Chance

Iconic Modifier

Drains a lot of stamina, but inflicts massive damage.

  • How to Get Sasquatch's Hammer: Looted from Sasquatch at the GIM in I Walk the Line

Sasquatch’s Hammer receives an iconic buff for 2.0, and with that comes a heavy cost. Sasquatch’s Hammer is mighty and weighty, meaning that players are going to struggle moving with it since it denies access to sprinting, dodging, dashing, and even significantly reduces movement speed. However, for players who feel like a tank to shrug off enemies, players are able to crush their enemies with each swing and heavy attack.

8 Cottonmouth

A Jack of All Trades for Elemental Effects

Type

One-Handed Club

Attack Speed

1.3

Damage Per Hit

160

Stamina Cost

9.6

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Stun Chance
  • +25% Shock Chance
  • +25% Poison Chance

Iconic Modifier

Small chance to apply Poison and/or Shock.

  • How to Get Cottonmouth: Found in Fingers' Clinic, Jig-Jig Street, in The Space in Between.

A one-handed club that’s a jack of all trades, the Cottonmouth provides a fair chance that the enemy struck by this weapon will be stunned or shocked, or even poisoned. However, the electrically charged and venomous weapon isn’t just decent because of the elements, but it’s good thanks to its damage and speed to provide a decent performance from a thin stick.

7 Crowbar

Become the Freeman

Type

One-Handed Club

Attack Speed

2.6

Damage Per Hit

106

Stamina Cost

9.6

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Stun Chance

Iconic Modifier

Trusty as always.

  • How to Get Crowbar: Found in a sewer grate during Somewhat Damaged with 20 Body Attribute (Phantom Liberty)

The Crowbar is always trusty and reliable as both a tool and a melee weapon, and this weapon has decent damage per hit, a chance to stun, but at a demanding stamina cost. Another drawback of the Crowbar is that players are forced to side with Solomon Reed, and even so, players might even miss this weapon due to its being held in the dark.

6 Baby Boomer

High Damage and Higher Crit Chance

Type

Two-Handed Club

Attack Speed

1.5

Damage Per Hit

171

Stamina Cost

12

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Bleeding Chance
  • +20% Stun Chance

Iconic Modifier

Every consecutive attack in a combo increases Crit chance.

  • How to Get Baby Boomer: Don't read Tool's letter in Dazed and Confused (Phantom Liberty)

The Baby Boomer is designed to be used in a combo of hard hits and swings, allowing players to use its low stamina cost to hit enemies repeatedly. With the Baby Boomer, each swing has a chance to provide bleeding and stun, and the more players hit an enemy, the higher the chance for a critical hit, meaning even more damage to bash brains and bones.

5 Gold-Plated Baseball Bat

Make Enemies Bleed With Ease

Type

Two-Handed Club

Attack Speed

1.2

Damage Per Hit

190

Stamina Cost

12

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +100% Bleeding Chance
  • +25% Stun Chance

Iconic Modifier

High chance to apply Bleeding. Low chance to apply Stun.

  • How to Get Gold-Plated Baseball Bat: Found in Denny's cement-filled pool in Second Conflict

The Gold-Plated Baseball Bat isn’t just used for its stellar design that exceeds known wealth, but for its incredible stats. One effect from the Gold-Plated Baseball Bat provides a 100% bleeding chance, which means that every hit from this vicious baseball bat will draw blood from enemies, and that’s with an additional 25% chance to stun enemies. It swings fast and hits hard, and is a lot of fun for those who just like hitting things for bruises instead of cuts.

4 Tinker Bell

Knock Out Targets with Electrifying Attacks

Type

One-Handed Club

Attack Speed

1.3

Damage Per Hit

131

Stamina Cost

9.6

Effects

  • +50% Armor Penetration
  • 1 sec Charge Time
  • +20% Stun Chance
  • +305 Shock Chance

Iconic Modifier

Deals less damage, but with a chance to knock out a target using a Strong Attack.

  • How to Get Tinker Bell: Found in the control room of Edgewood Farm during The Hunt

The less damage provided by Tinker Bell is insignificant in the long run, especially when one considers the stun chance and shock chance provided with each attack. Players can even charge Tinker Bell for 1 second to provide a strong attack that might knock out enemies, forcing enemies to drop to the ground. If players are seeking a shock baton to repeatedly stun, shock, and knockout enemies, then Tinker Bell will easily send them to Neverland, even if it’s a weapon with creepy origins from River Ward.

3 Murphy’s Law

Everything That Can Happen Will Happen with Murphy’s Law

Type

One-Handed Club

Attack Speed

1.71

Damage Per Hit

133.43

Stamina Cost

8

Effects

  • +50% Armor Penetration
  • 1 sec Charge Time
  • +20% Bleeding Chance
  • +20% Stun Chance
  • +20% Shock Chance

Iconic Modifier

Hits against a knocked-down enemy increases attack speed. Strong attacks deal more damage.

  • How to Get Murphy's Law: Loot Albert Murphy in Firestarter after siding with Songbird (Phantom Liberty)

Murphy’s Law is a spoiled weapon, and one that can basically do anything. With different chances for armor penetration, bleeding chance, stun chance, and shock chance, players have an appropriately named weapon. With attacks that can hit multiple enemies at once, Murphy’s Law provides brutal swings at the cost of very little stamina, which is even better when facing knocked-down enemies, thanks to a further increase in attack speed and more damage from strong attacks.

2 Sir John Phallustiff

Lewd, Crude, and Stronger Than Ever

Type

One-Handed Club

Attack Speed

2.2

Damage Per Hit

109

Stamina Cost

9.6

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Stun Chance

Iconic Modifier

Strike your enemy in the face and watch their pride crumble as your Crit Chance rises!

  • How to Get Sir John Phallustiff: Complete Venus in Furs by keeping Meredith Stout alive in Act One's The Pickup.

After spending a memorable night with Meredith Stout, players are gifted a toy on the bed that can be used in pleasure and war. This weapon, Sir John Phallustiff, is far too lewd to showcase here, but there’s no denying its power. Every hit will increase crit chance, and every hit also has a chance to stun foes, probably out of confusion for what they’ve just been hit by. With strong damage and nice stamina cost, Sir John Phallustiff is hilarious to use and equally as powerful as it is humorous.

item.title: Dahlia Build Guide In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Dahlia is a playable 4-star Support in Genshin Impact . Dahlia is a Hydro unit who protects his team with shields and increases their Attack SPD. To make the most of his kit, here’s Dahlia’s best build in Genshin Impact , including his best artifact sets and weapons.

Dahlia Build In Genshin Impact

Weapon

Artifact Set

Stats

  1. Key of Khaj-Nisut
  2. Sacrificial Sword
  3. Favonius Sword
  4. The Dockhand's Assistant
  5. Skyward Blade
  6. Skyrider Sword
  7. Festering Desire

  • Noblesse Oblige

  • Timepiece: HP or Energy Recharge
  • Goblet: HP
  • Circlet: HP
  • Sub-stat: Energy Recharge and HP.

Dahlia Best Artifact In Genshin Impact

As a Support unit who depends on his Elemental Burst, it’s easy to build Dahlia’s artifact set in Genshin Impact . Give Dahlia the Noblesse Oblige set, and it will grant him the ability to buff the team’s ATK% by 20% every time he casts his Elemental Burst. The set’s effect almost has the same duration as Dahlia’s Ultimate’s cooldown, which is perfect for his gameplay as a Support in Genshin Impact . There’s no need for any alternative artifact sets as this one is the perfect match for Dahlia’s build.

Additionally, Dahlia shields his team with a shield that scales with his Max HP. He also buffs the active character’s Attack SPD by up to 20% if his Max HP reaches 40,000. This makes it crucial to build Dahlia with as much HP as possible until he reaches 40k , then switch the priority to Energy Recharge.

Dahlia Best Weapon In Genshin Impact

When it comes to the best weapon for Dahlia in Genshin Impact , it’s important to balance between his Sword’s Sub-stat and his artifact set’s Timepiece, keeping in mind that Dahlia needs to reach 40k Max HP. If the Timepiece is on HP%, and Dahlia reached the 40k Max HP requirement, then go for an Energy Recharge Sword. Basically, as long as Dahlia isn’t at 40k Max HP, keep adding more HP stats.

Key of Khaj-Nisut and Sacrificial Sword are the best weapons for Dahlia when it comes to adding HP and Energy Recharge, respectively. Of course, it’s not easy to obtain Key of Khaj-Nisut since it’s a 5-star weapon in Genshin Impact . You can give the Dockhand's Assistant as a 4-star alternative option, as it also gives Dahlia HP% from its Sub-stat. Both weapons don’t really add anything to Dahlia’s kit from their passives, so they’re purely a stat stick for him.

As for Energy Recharge weapons, many Swords in Genshin Impact have this Sub-stat, and most of them are F2P-friendly. Starting from Sacrificial Sword , it gives Dahlia a chance to cast his Elemental Skill twice, which further ensures that he can cast his Elemental Burst on every rotation. Favonius Sword is a close second with its effect that makes Dahlia operate as a battery for the team. Finally, Skyward Blade , Skyrider Sword , and Festering Desire are all decent stat stick options if you’re planning to build Dahlia with more Energy Recharge.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Best Weapons For Skirk In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Skirk is a playable Sword user in Genshin Impact . She needs Swords that buff her Normal ATK DMG and Crit value. This list will rank the best weapons for Skirk in Genshin Impact .

8 Sturdy Bone

Primary Stat

565 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

27.6% ATK

R5 Effect

Sprint or Alternate Sprint Stamina Consumption decreased by 15%. Additionally, after using Sprint or Alternate Sprint, Normal Attack DMG is increased by 32% of ATK. This effect expires after triggering 18 times or 7s.

Starting from Sturdy Bone , Skirk can use the 4-star’s high Base ATK and ATK% Sub-stat. The weapon also increases her Normal Attack DMG when she sprints. It’s a good choice, but it doesn’t come close to other options since it doesn’t offer more than that.

7 Absolution

Primary Stat

674 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

44.1% Crit DMG

Effect

CRIT DMG increased by 20%. Increasing the value of a Bond of Life increases the DMG the equipping character deals by 16% for 6s. Max 3 stacks.

Absolution is a good 5-star choice for Skirk since it offers a high amount of Crit DMG alongside a really high Base ATK. However, she doesn’t benefit from the rest of the effects, which lowers Absolution’s ranking among Skirk’s best weapons in Genshin Impact .

6 Primordial Jade Cutter

Primary Stat

542 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

44.1% Crit Rate

Effect

HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 1.2% of the wielder's Max HP.

Primordial Jade Cutter grants Skirk a massive Crit Rate upgrade, but that’s where the benefits stop. Primordial’s Base ATK is low for a 5-star weapon, on top of having a passive that barely increases Skirk’s ATK%.

While Primordial Jade Cutter is not an ideal option for Skirk, it’s a solid choice if players don’t have any of Skirk’s best weapons in Genshin Impact .

5 Calamity of Eshu

Primary Stat

565 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

27.6% ATK

R5 Effect

While characters are protected by a Shield, DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks is increased by 40%, and Normal and Charged Attack CRIT Rate is increased by 16%.

Calamity of Eshu is almost a perfect 4-star weapon for Skirk in Genshin Impact . The weapon offers a lot of benefits for Skirk, such as increasing Skirk’s ATK% while having a high Base ATK for a 4-star Sword. Not only that, but Skirk also gets up to 16% Crit Rate and 40% DMG increase on her Normal Attacks from Calamity’s passive, which is a lot for a 4-star. The only downside is that players need to pair Skirk with a shielder in Genshin Impact .

4 The Black Sword

Primary Stat

510 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

27.6% Crit Rate

R5 Effect

Increases DMG dealt by Normal and Charged Attacks by 40%.

Additionally, regenerates 100% of ATK as HP when Normal and Charged Attacks score a CRIT Hit. This effect can occur once every 5s.

When talking about the best 4-star weapon for Skirk in Genshin Impact , The Black Sword is the one. Unfortunately, it’s not an F2P weapon for Skirk as it’s in the battle pass. The Black Sword grants Skirk a decent Base ATK with a Crit Rate Sub-stat, alongside a buff to Skirk’s Normal Attack DMG.

3 Mistsplitter Reforged

Primary Stat

674 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

44.1% Crit DMG

Effect

Gain a 12% Elemental DMG Bonus for all elements and receive the might of the Mistsplitter's Emblem. At stack levels 1/2/3, Mistsplitter's Emblem provides a 8/16/28% Elemental DMG Bonus for the character's Elemental Type. The character will obtain 1 stack of Mistsplitter's Emblem in each of the following scenarios: Normal Attack deals Elemental DMG (stack lasts 5s), casting Elemental Burst (stack lasts 10s); Energy is less than 100% (stack disappears when Energy is full). Each stack's duration is calculated independently.

Mistsplitter Reforged is another good 5-star Sword for Skirk in Genshin Impact . The weapon massively increases Skirk’s Elemental DMG, which is what she will deal when she uses her Normal Attacks. It also buffs her Crit DMG while having a higher Base ATK than most 5-star weapons in Genshin Impact .

Considering Skirk will replace Ayaka in every Morgana team in Genshin Impact , it only makes sense to steal her Signature weapon too.

2 Haran Geppaku Futsu

Primary Stat

608 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

33.1% Crit Rate

Effect

Obtain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. When other nearby party members use Elemental Skills, the character equipping this weapon will gain 1 Wavespike stack. Max 2 stacks. This effect can be triggered once every 0.3s. When the character equipping this weapon uses an Elemental Skill, all stacks of Wavespike will be consumed to gain Rippling Upheaval: each stack of Wavespike consumed will increase Normal Attack DMG by 20% for 8s.

Skirk doesn’t only use Ayaka’s Signature weapon; she can also use Ayato’s Signature weapon, Haran Geppaku Futsu . Having access to this amount of Crit Rate Sub-stat and a decent Base ATK is good enough for Skirk’s gameplay. On the other hand, Skirk will get extra Elemental DMG and Normal Attack DMG when she uses Haran Geppaku Futsu. It’s a decent amount that makes Ayato’s Signature weapon one of the best Swords for Skirk in Genshin Impact .

1 Azurelight

Primary Stat

674 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

22.1% Crit Rate

Effect

Within 12s after an Elemental Skill is used, ATK is increased by 24%. During this time, when the equipping character has 0 Energy, ATK will be further increased by 24%, and CRIT DMG will be increased by 40%.

When it comes to Skirk’s best weapon, Azurelight is easily her best Sword in Genshin Impact . Just like most offensive Swords on this list, Skirk gets a good amount of Base ATK and Crit Rate from Azurelight’s stats. In addition to that, Azurelight greatly buffs Skirk’s ATK% and Crit DMG, which is exactly what she needs to dominate every combat with her DPS.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Skirk Team Composition Guide In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Since she needs Hydro and Cryo characters in her team, Skirk teams might face some limitations in Genshin Impact . On the other hand, there are a lot of Cryo and Hydro units that can join Skirk teams. So, here’s a list of the best teams for Skirk in Genshin Impact .

1 Skirk + Escoffier + Furina + Ayato

Ayato ’s Elemental Burst in Genshin Impact continuously applies Hydro in a large area, even when he’s off-field. Not only that, but Ayato’s garden of purity increases Skirk’s Normal Attack DMG by 20% with a near 100% uptime, which is more than enough when considering the team’s rotation. Furina also helps with the Hydro application while she’s notably buffing the entire team’s DMG.

Of course, to pull Furina’s buff, players need a healer in this Skirk team, which is Escoffier . She’s not only a sufficient healer who quickly meets Furina’s requirements, but Escoffier also greatly reduces enemies’ resistance to Hydro and Cryo while dealing a lot of off-field Cryo DMG. Players can also replace Ayato with Shenhe to team three strong Supports with Skirk. As long as the team has only Cryo and Hydro buffers and debuffers, it will maximize Skirk’s buffs from her kit and allow her to deal maximum DMG.

Team Roles

  • Skirk: Main DPS, Cryo Enabler
  • Escoffier: Support, Sub-DPS, Cryo Enabler, Debuffer, Healer
  • Furina: Support, Sub-DPS, Hydro Enabler, Buffer, Healer
  • Ayato: Sub-DPS, Hydro Enabler, Buffer

2 Skirk + Escoffier + Furina + Kazuha

Skirk operates at her best when she’s teaming with Hydro and Cryo characters in Genshin Impact . That gives players a lot of freedom when building Skirk’s team, as there are a lot of useful characters that can join her team. At the same time, it also restricts Skirk from teaming with other elements since it’s not easy to compensate for the DMG loss.

The only character outside Hydro and Cryo that can effectively team up with Skirk in Genshin Impact is Kazuha , since his buffs and debuffs are still one of the best in the game. Giving Skirk 40% extra Cryo DMG alongside shredding enemies' resistance to Cryo DMG by 40% is worth it.

On the other hand, team Skirk with Escoffier and Furina to maximize the buffs and debuffs Skirk can get from this team. Kazuha also has good Crowd Control, where he’ll collect enemies in one spot to make the most of Skirk's Normal Attacks.

Team Roles

  • Skirk: Main DPS, Cryo Enabler
  • Escoffier: Support, Sub-DPS, Cryo Enabler, Debuffer, Healer
  • Furina: Support, Sub-DPS, Hydro Enabler, Buffer, Healer
  • Kazuha: Support, Crowd Control, Buffer, Debuffer

3 Skirk + Citlali + Shenhe + Yelan

To add more variety and showcase how easy it is to build a Skirk team in Genshin Impact , this team will have three different Hydro and Cryo characters. In this team, Skirk’s Normal Attacks also trigger Yelan ’s coordinated Hydro Attacks, which create an endless amount of Frozen reactions. Although Yelan is the only Hydro unit, she’s more than capable of fulfilling her role as a Hydro Enabler. Citlali utilizes her strong Cryo application to trigger more Frozen reactions while shredding enemies’ resistance to Yelan’s Hydro. As for Shenhe , she operates as a buffer for Skirk’s Cryo DMG while further reducing enemies' resistance to Cryo.

All in all, as long as there are Cryo and Hydro characters dealing off-field DMG and offering decent buffs and debuffs, Skirk teams will always shine in Genshin Impact .

Team Roles

  • Skirk: Main DPS, Cryo Enabler
  • Citlali: Support, Shielder, Cryo Enabler, Debuffer
  • Shenhe: Support, Cryo Enabler, Buffer, Debuffer
  • Yelan: Sub-DPS, Hydro Enabler, Buffer

4 Skirk + Nahida + Shenhe + Thoma

Although Skirk works better with Frozen reactions, she can still work in Melt teams in Genshin Impact . The idea is to add one Dendro and one Pyro character to Skirk’s team so they can trigger the Burning reaction. The reaction will continuously apply Pyro on enemies as Skirk consumes them to trigger Melt, greatly increasing her DPS.

First, Skirk needs a strong Dendro Enabler like Nahida or Emilie in Genshin Impact . After that, adding a decent Pyro Enabler completes the task and sets the field ready for Skirk to dominate it. The only downside to this Skirk team comp is the massive DMG buff Skirk loses when her team isn’t fully made of Cryo and Hydro units.

Team Roles

  • Skirk: Main DPS, Cryo Enabler
  • Nahida: Support, Sub-DPS, Dendro Enabler, Buffer
  • Shenhe: Support, Cryo Enabler, Buffer, Debuffer
  • Thoma: Support, Shielder, Pyro Enabler, Buffer

5 Skirk + Xingqiu + Dahlia + Layla

For an F2P Skirk team in Genshin Impact , team Skirk with Xingqiu to allow both to continuously apply their elements when she’s attacking. Both Dahlia and Layla operate as shielders with a small buff to Skirk’s DPS. Dahlia increases Skirk's Attack SPD, which notably improves her Normal Attacks. As for Layla in Genshin Impact , her fourth Constellation increases Skirk’s Normal Attack DMG based on her Max HP. Although this Skirk team is not comparable to the previous ones, it’s still a sufficient team that can get the job done.

Other 4-star alternatives for Dahlia/Layla include Candace , Rosaria , Mika , Diona , and Charlotte .

Team Roles

  • Skirk: Main DPS, Cryo Enabler
  • Xingqiu: Sub-DPS, Hydro Enabler, Minor Healer
  • Dahlia: Support, Shielder, Buffer
  • Layla: Support, Shielder, Cryo Enabler, Buffer

item.title: 8 Best Villains in FromSoftware Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • FromSoftware's villains are morally complex and compelling, adding depth to their games.
  • Top villains like Isshin, Gehrman, and Artorias offer memorable boss fights with emotional depth.
  • Characters like Owl, Moon Presence, and Aldia challenge players with their morally ambiguous nature.

FromSoftware is already well-known for their boss fights, but sometimes the numerous large, hulking monsters can actually mask how great their villains are. Not just because they're fearsome, but because they're often complex characters with a lot of moral ambiguity depending on the individual player.

Whether it's tired Gods attempting to keep the world going or world-famous swordsmen, FromSoftware has a wealth of great villains to choose from. This list is ranked by how memorable and compelling each villain is.

8 Isshin, The Sword Saint

The Master Swordsman

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice
18
9.4 /10
Released
March 22, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

The world of Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice may look like normal Sengoku-era Japan, but it's a mythical version of history full of divine magic and ancient prophecies, and, pointedly, old men who can be reborn as their prime selves through their descendants. It's... weird.

Isshin, the Sword Saint, in lore, is considered the finest swordsman to ever exist, and Wolf must take him down to finally end the curse of the Dragon Heritage. It's an incredibly dramatic and challenging fight that requires everything a player has learned to overcome, and is possibly the toughest final boss fight in video games .

7 Gehrman, The First Hunter

Master Of The Dream

6 Images
6 Images
Bloodborne
20
9.1 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

Bloodborne takes place in a world that is in the process of dying, but it can be reborn if the right choices are made. Some hunters willingly accept that new day, while others guard against it. Gehrman, the First Hunter , is the master of the Hunter's Dream and will do anything to keep it going.

The fight with Gehrman is stunningly dramatic, taking place in a field of white flowers as he chases the player down with a massive scythe. The fight is memorable, Gehrman's fate as a thrall of the Moon Presence is tragic, and fighting him feels like the apex of Bloodborne's frenzied combat system.

6 Artorias The Abysswalker

The Tragic Knight

5 Images
5 Images
Dark Souls
9 /10
13
9.2 /10
Released
September 22, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Violence
Powered by

By this point, FromSoftware has become well known for creating consistently tragic characters who fall from grace through no fault of their own. Artorias the Abysswalker from Dark Souls is the template for these tragic figures, and he's a fan favorite to this day.

Artorias opposes the player as they venture into Oolacile, but only because he has gone insane from fighting the Abyss for too long. He was a brave knight who became consumed by his enemy, and it's up to the player to put him down for good. He's a villain against his own will, and it makes for a surprisingly emotional boss fight.

5 Owl

The Absent Father

  • From: Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice

The Shinobi, Owl, picked Wolf out of a battlefield and raised him as his son. While players might think that Owl would take on a paternal role, that couldn't be further from the truth. In fact, Owl is probably one of the worst dads in all of gaming, and likely one of the hardest optional bosses in gaming, too.

Instead of being a father, Owl consistently uses Wolf for his own ends, never hesitating to throw his surrogate son under the bus if it means getting what he wants. He's a devilishly evil character who feels incredibly satisfying to conquer for his betrayal.

4 The Moon Presence

The Lovecraftian God

  • From: Bloodborne

The nature of Lovecraftian entities is that their motivations are very often obscure. In fact, almost by definition, it is impossible for human minds to comprehend their true intentions, meaning that, as a villain to conquer, they are full of mystery and intrigue.

That's never been truer than with the Moon Presence , the true final boss of Bloodborne, who seems to be fueling the Hunter's Dream and is ostensibly responsible for the collapsing realities in Yarnham. Players have long theorized about the Moon Presence's motivations, yet its stunning and otherworldly appearance makes it an eerie and compelling villain to conquer.

3 Aldia, Scholar Of The First Sin

Mad Philosopher King

Powered by

Dark Souls 2 has always been the black sheep of the FromSoftware catalog, with many fans dismissing it out of hand. However, with the release of its three DLCs, Dark Souls 2 has enjoyed a rehabilitation in popular opinion, particularly due to the inclusion of Aldia, Scholar of the First Sin.

Aldia, the brother of King Vendrick, is a philosopher gone mad in his pursuit of figuring out how to break the cycle of rebirth that haunts the worlds of the Dark Souls series. More than any other character, Aldia challenges the player to really think about what they're doing and why, seeding similar discussions that would emerge in Dark Souls 3 . He's an intellectual powerhouse and a source of debate among fans to this day.

2 Miquella

The Unalloyed

When the original Elden Ring arrived, none of the many demigods inspired more mystery and debate than Miquella , the absent brother of Malenia, who was seemingly kidnapped and killed by Mohg. However, with the release of the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, everything changed.

It turned out that Miquella was a master manipulator who had concocted a plan to ascend to Godhood himself by manipulating other people to do his bidding. While his manipulation and control of others is clearly villainous, he does it with good intentions, making him one of the most morally ambiguous and complex characters in Elden Ring .

1 Gwyn

The Lord Of Cinders

  • From: Dark Souls

More than any other villain in the FromSoftware catalog, Gwyn is an endlessly compelling, morally complex, and tragic figure who defines how players perceive FromSoftware bosses and lore. Gwyn undoubtedly did many morally dubious things during his life, but he ultimately wants to save the world even if it means that the world becomes sick and corrupted.

Gwyn's refusal to link the fire and bring about a new version of reality is core to the series' meditation on rebirth, resurrection, and renewal. Many players still think that Gwyn was doing the right thing, as the possibility of future realities could be worse than the one he was preserving. He's a compelling antagonist due to his relatable desire to hold onto what he has, making him one of the best villains FromSoftware has ever created.
